amendment.description: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to prohibiting the Council on Environmental Quality and the Environmental Protection Agency from promulgating rules or guidance that bans hydraulic fracturing in the United States.

vote.text: Amendment SA 833 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 43. Record Vote Number: 28.

action.text: Amendment SA 833 proposed by Senator Braun. (consideration: CR S442-443; text: CR S442) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to prohibiting the Council on Environmental Quality and the Environmental Protection Agency from promulgating rules or guidance that bans hydraulic fracturing in the United States.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 833 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 43. Record Vote Number: 28.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 833 proposed by Senator Braun.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 833 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 43. Record Vote Number: 28.
